doc:
John Dall https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Dall 0 John Dall (May 26, 1920 – January 15, 1971) was an American actor. Primarily a stage actor, he is best remembered today for two film roles: the cool-minded intellectual killer in Alfred Hitchcock's Rope (1948), and the trigger-happy lead in the 1950 film noir Gun Crazy. He also had a substantial role in Stanley Kubrick's Spartacus (1960). He first came to fame as the young prodigy who comes alive under the tutelage of Bette Davis in The Corn Is Green (1945), for which he was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor. John_Dall ( May_26_,_1920 – January_15_,_1971 ) was an_American_actor . Primarily a_stage_actor , he is_best_remembered today for two_film_roles : the_cool-minded_intellectual_killer in Alfred_Hitchcock 's_Rope_(_1948_) , and the_trigger-happy_lead in the_1950_film_noir_Gun_Crazy . He also had a_substantial_role in Stanley_Kubrick 's_Spartacus_(_1960_) . He first came to fame as the_young_prodigy who comes alive under the_tutelage of Bette_Davis in The_Corn Is Green ( 1945_) , for which he was_nominated for the_Academy_Award for Best_Supporting_Actor .
